Package org.shikha.cache

Class Cache<K,​V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.shikha.cache.Cache<K,​V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - Type of Cache Key
    V - Type of Cache Value
    public class Cache<K,​V>
extends java.lang.Object
    Cache class is used to create the cache which can take any type of Key and Value. Eviction Strategy is pluggable using the CacheConfiguration file and default Eviction is LRU. Expiry policy is also pluggable using the CacheConfiguration file and by default there is no expiry policy.

    • Method Detail

      • getStore

        public java.util.Map<K,​CacheValue<V>> getStore()

      • put

        public void put​(K key,
                V value)
         throws CacheException
        Adding the value in cache. If size is full then it checks if there is expiry policy then expire the keys as per policy. If expiry policy is not configured then it checks for eviction strategy and evict the keys so that a new element can be added into cache.
        Parameters:
        key - cache key
        value - cache value
        Throws:
        CacheException

      • get

        public V get​(K key)
        Gets the value for a particular key in cache.
        Parameters:
        key - key
        Returns:
        it returns the cache value.

      • registerEventListner

        public void registerEventListner​(java.lang.String name,
                                 CacheEventListner lister)
        This method is used to listen to events occurring on the cache. Observer must implement the CacheEventListner interface.
        Parameters:
        name -
        lister -

      • deregisterEventListner

        public void deregisterEventListner​(java.lang.String name)
        This method is to deregister to cache events.
        Parameters:
        name - : name of listener.
